title: (x) Satanic serif typeface - custom designed (several alternatives) {gang}
content:
Hi there :)

I was hoping anyone here could help me identify a font my client wants to use for a horror show. The font looks sort of satanic. The capital letter "S" has a devilish tail attached at the bottom, the "t" looks like a tall catholic cross, and the "o" has a cross inside it. The lower case "i" appears in two different hights.

Any help would be tremendously appreciated! Thanks, Tanya

PS If anyone can recommend another satanic/devilish type font, that would be great too!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140513182346im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SatanicFont_4675.jpeg)
author: Tanya Voormeij

comments.content:
It looks like a modified Mason, but this could be one of the poorly drawn rip-offs from free font land.

- Lex
You might also be interested in [this thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20140513182346/http:/typophile.com/node/29626).

Because identical letters are not identical it points to a hand-drawn logo, or something hand-customized.

Similar fonts could be [Mason Serif (or Sans)](http://web.archive.org/web/20140513182346/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=Mason&image.x=18&image.y=8) from Emigre.

Another called ['Blackfriar'](http://web.archive.org/web/20140513182346/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=C.100732.0.0) actually has horns on the 'g'.

For some reason [Percolator](http://web.archive.org/web/20140513182346/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=C.100897.0.0) seems to show up in a lot of devil-ish contexts, maybe because it 'perverts' normal letters?

Another font with somewhat arcane letterforms is Font Bureau's [Saber](http://web.archive.org/web/20140513182346/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FB.111998.0.0).

There are many others that just need some imagination and creepy shading to look sinister.

- Mike Yanega
(Please resist the temptation to link to said rip-offs. Thanks!)

Actually [Hrant Papazian](http://web.archive.org/web/20140513182346/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Hrant%20Papazian) developed a series of designs collectively called Daam. I've always thought his [Brutaal](http://web.archive.org/web/20140513182346/http:/www.themicrofoundry.com/f_brutaal.html) was particularly devilish! ;^p
